questions.question: What is Machine Learning?
options: A) A method of automating model building
B) A process for creating algorithms
C) A technique for data analysis

questions.question: Which of the following is a type of supervised learning?
What is an example of unsupervised learning?
Which algorithm is commonly used for classification tasks?
What does 'overfitting' mean in the context of machine learning?
options: A) The model performs well on training data but poorly on unseen data
B) The model performs poorly on both training and unseen data
C) The model performs well on both training and unseen data

questions.question: Which technique is used to prevent overfitting?
What is a neural network?
options: A) A type of machine learning algorithm inspired by the structure and function of biological neural networks
B) A method for data visualization
C) A technique for feature selection

questions.question: Which layer is responsible for learning complex patterns in a neural network?
What does 'bias' refer to in the context of machine learning?
options: A) The error rate of a model
B) A parameter that influences the output of a neural network
C) The amount of data used for training

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for clustering?
What is the purpose of a 'loss function' in machine learning?
options: A) To measure how well a model's predictions match the actual data
B) To optimize the model parameters

questions.question: Which technique is used to improve the generalization of a machine learning model?
What is 'feature scaling' in machine learning?
options: A) The process of selecting the most relevant features for a model
B) The process of normalizing or standardizing feature values
C) The process of removing outliers from data

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for regression tasks?
What does 'underfitting' mean in the context of machine learning?
options: A) The model performs well on training data but poorly on unseen data
B) The model performs poorly on both training and unseen data
C) The model performs well on both training and unseen data

questions.question: Which technique is used to prevent underfitting?
options: C) Increasing the complexity of the model

questions.question: What is a 'confusion matrix' in machine learning?
options: A) A table used to describe the performance of a classification model
B) A method for feature selection
C) A technique for data normalization

questions.question: Which metric is commonly used to evaluate the accuracy of a classification model?
What is 'cross-validation' in machine learning?
options: A) A technique for splitting data into training and testing sets
B) A method for evaluating the performance of a model by partitioning the data into subsets
C) A process for feature scaling

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for anomaly detection?
What does 'supervised learning' mean in the context of machine learning?
options: A) The model learns from labeled data
B) The model learns from unlabeled data
C) The model learns from a combination of labeled and unlabeled data

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for dimensionality reduction?
What does 'unsupervised learning' mean in the context of machine learning?
options: A) The model learns from labeled data
B) The model learns from unlabeled data
C) The model learns from a combination of labeled and unlabeled data

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for reinforcement learning?
What does 'bias-variance tradeoff' mean in the context of machine learning?
options: A) The tradeoff between model complexity and training error
B) The tradeoff between model accuracy and computational efficiency
C) The tradeoff between model interpretability and performance

questions.question: Which technique is used to handle missing data in a dataset?
